717280f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Bond Street
717280f-a.text:
Broadway, north from the head of Bond to East 10th Streets and
showing Grace P.E. Church at that point. This instantaneous photo is
taken from the Grand Central Hotel (now the Broadway Central Hotel),
a portion of which appears on the left. Note the East River National
Bank, No. 682 Broadway, at the S.E. corner of Great Jones Street. In
Bromley's Atlas of New York 1922 this institution is shown at No. 680,
a 4-story structure adjoining the same corner. Broadway in the distance,
veers true northward because of the refusal of one Brevoort to permit
the Commissioners Plan of 1811 to be placed into effect; he thereby saving
a favorite tree that would have been destroyed.
af
About 1875.
Gift of H. D. Jewett.
